InstaNote

One-tap Android note widget for instant note capture and Gmail auto-send, plus a lightweight in-app list.

Problem

Capturing a thought on mobile should be frictionless. Opening a full note app, creating a new note, and saving it is slow when you just want to jot something down or email it to yourself. I wanted a one-tap widget for instant typing, quick share, and a “send-to-self” path that handles attachments.

Approach

I built an Android home-screen widget that launches a minimal, bottom-aligned note sheet. From there you can type immediately, share to any app, attach a file via the system picker, or send the note (and attachments) to your Gmail using a signed-in account. Notes can optionally be saved locally and managed in a simple list with quick deletion.

Architecture

  • App Widget (NoteWidgetProvider) — RemoteViews layout that triggers NoteEntryActivity via PendingIntent.
  • Entry Sheet (NoteEntryActivity) — Transparent, keyboard-first UI for typing, sharing, file attach, and Gmail send.
  • Main List (MainActivity) — RecyclerView bound to SharedPreferences (JSON via Gson) with a two-step delete confirm.
  • Settings (SettingsActivity) — Google Sign-In with Gmail send scope; sign-in/out and version display.
  • Data store — Local only; SharedPreferences stores a JSON array of notes under com.example.simplenote.notes.
  • Share intents — Handles ACTION_SEND and ACTION_SEND_MULTIPLE to auto-send shared text/files to Gmail and finish.

Stack

  • Android (SDK 34, minSdk 24) — Kotlin app using ViewBinding and XML layouts.
  • Gmail API + Google Sign-In — google-api-services-gmail with gmail.send scope to send to the signed-in user.
  • Google HTTP + Jackson — For API client transport and JSON handling (Gmail client setup).
  • JavaMail (android-mail/activation) — Builds text + multipart messages with file attachments.
  • UI — Material Toolbar, FAB, custom shapes; widget uses a compact green square with a white plus.

Challenges

  • Gmail on-device auth — Coordinating Google Sign-In with Gmail API client; resolved with explicit gmail.send scope and compatible client libs.
  • Share intents w/ attachments — Handling EXTRA_STREAM lists and metadata via contentResolver, then composing a multipart email.
  • Deletion UX — Implemented a lightweight two-tap confirm in the list (temporary state via Handler) to avoid accidental loss.
  • Widget constraints — Kept RemoteViews minimal for reliability; single tap opens the editor fast with IME focus.

Outcomes

The widget makes capture effectively instant: tap → type. Sharing pushes notes to other apps, and the “email without save” path sends notes (and attachments) to your inbox automatically. The app ships as v1.0.7, with local note management, sign-in/out, and a clean, distraction-free UI.
